column1: Uniquely identify product based on category and attributes.
column2: ID of the unique order placed by any customer. This data set could have repeated orderID to denote the group of products brought together in a single order by the customer.
column3: Number of units of the mentioned productid purchased as a part of this order
column4: Revenue generated by this product in this order.
column5: Date on which the sale was made or the order was executed.
column6: Store where the order was executed.
column7: Region where the store is placed and order was executed.

column1: Uniquely identify product based on category and attributes.
column3: Price at which product is intended to be sold.
column4: Number of units purchased. Which denotes how many units are expected to be added to the Inventory.
column5: Date when the item is expected in the inventory.
column6: Store which made the purchase. This item would be added to the warehouse of this store.

column1: Uniquely identify product based on category and attributes.
column2: High level category to define the product. This denotes significant difference in product.
column3: General tag associated with the product to indicate the season or demographic that the product targets. Festive or wedding
column4: Cloth material used to make the product.
column5: Type of handiwork done on the product.

column2: (The columns denote region names, North, south, east and west)
column3: Row value indicate the names of the stores.
